document_data.caption: The lair of "Queen" Vorazidrar at the edge of Throden village.
document_data.name: Throden
document_data.text: The Queen was strong. Now she is not, and has no more gifts.
document_data.mainbody:
The lizardfolk of Throden were emotionless and calculating, and were neither afraid of nor offended by strangers in their settlement. Unlike the kobolds, who mocked those they fought, the lizardfolk merely observed without judgment and took no delight in victory. Also unlike the kobolds, the lizardfolk disliked the conflict that the Queen's presence had brought, and were not particularly loyal to her except out of practicality. They offered her "gifts" of tribute in exchange for gifts of protection.

===Notable Inhabitants===
* [[Othokent]], leader of the Throden lizardfolk in the late 15{{th}} century DR.
* [[Spittleburn]], a leader among the Queenstooth kobolds in the late 15{{th}} century DR.
document_data.Description:
Originally a lizardfolk settlement, the older and more central parts of the village were far larger than a first glance would suggest. The newer outskirts showed signs of kobold construction, and was designed for the benefit of both lizardfolk and kobolds.

All roads in Throden eventually led to Vorazidrar's lair, a stone cave located in the deepest swamp waters.
document_data.Government: While the lizardfolk were led by [[Othokent]] and the Queenstooth kobolds had leaders such as [[Spittleburn]], both groups acknowledged Vorazidrar as their "Queen" as of the late 15{{th}} century DR.
document_data.Defenses: The village was under constant threat from both the growth of the swamp and the predations of the other inhabitants, such as the [[Muckgrunter]] [[troll]]s, the [[holdfast vine]]s, various local monsters, and [[meenlock]]s from the [[Feywild]]. Keeping the area safe required the coordinated effort of both the kobolds—who ventured into the swamp and formed a perimeter to keep invaders away from the village—and the lizardfolk—who defended the village proper and provided reinforcements to the kobolds as needed. Lizardfolk patrols also kept and eye on visitors and occasionally lured them into traps. These patrols could navigate the dangerous swamp with ease, and were only encountered if they wished to be.

Throden as a lizardfolk settlement was quite old. The kobolds arrived alongside Vorazidrar sometime before the 15{{th}} century DR, at which point the village became home to both groups after the kobolds sought them out for greater protection. Despite the constant conflict within Forestfall Fen, Vorazidrar kept the village nominally safe, such as by killing [[Wrathburn (wight)|Wrathburn]], an [[adventurer]] from [[the North]].

Vorazidrar's reign ended in the late 15{{th}} century DR when a party of adventurers trapped her in her lair on the orders of the [[Open Lord]] of [[Waterdeep]], [[Laeral Silverhand]]. The lizardfolk were not upset to see her deposed.
